Posts.Content: My history is listed below. I know I was fortunate to have Gleason 6. My heart goes out to those who continue to "fight the bear." I continue running 40 miles a week. I am fully continent and often sleep through the night , without a trip to the bathroom. In a public restroom I am in and out as fast as when I was 20. ED has been an ongoing issue - However- In the past year or so I started noticing a semi- erection occuring between 12-3 AM. This continues to improve. In the past several months , I often have very good "wood" during this time period, without any meds. The erection lasts about 10 minutes, and my wife and I take full advantage....... Anyway, I had considered injections, but I am holding off on that now. My major point is that nerves can take a LONG TIME to recover- slower than cold molasses, but they CAN heal over time.
Posts.Signature: 59 years old 11/2010- PSA 1.82 11/2011- PSA 2.55 12/2012 -PSA 2.40 10/2013 -PSA 4.0 Sulfa 2 weeks 11/2013 -PSA 5.02 2/2014- PSA 6.1 Negative DRE Biopsy -12/23/2013-(on my birthday): 2/12 cores positive for prostatic adenocarcinoma (3%, 5%) -T1c / Gleason 6 (both cores 3+3) Partin Table-83 % chance organ confined 2/18/2014- Radical Retropubic Prostatectomy at University of Colorado Hospital Pathology- Adenocarcinoma-2 tumors - pT2a ;Gleason 6; 1% of prostate; Clear margins; High grade PIN; Acute/Chronic inflammation; Weight 40 G Good urinary control at 3 weeks; Started running at week 6; Currently run 7 miles to work everyday with a 15 lb backpack. PSA -3/2014- .02; 7/2014- .02; 3/2015- .02; 12/2015- .02
Posts.Title: 2.5 years post surgery; Update

Posts.Content: Try this- Go to amazon and search for: Neoprene Rubber Sheet - 1/8" Thick x 6" Width x 6" Length - 5 Pack Sold by: Rubber-Cal Cut the sheet into a circle maybe 6 inches in diameter. make a hole in the middle slightly smaller than your penis width. Makes an excellent seal, even with a cheap pump. The retainer ring with ears has worked fine for me. No breakage.

Posts.Title: Vacuum Pumps

Posts.Content: I found this information interesting- (From Harvard Medical School) "After statistical adjustments, the increase from 4.3 to 8.6 is the 84% increase in risk that many news reports focused on. Researchers call that the relative risk (one group compared to another). The absolute increase, 4.3 cases per 1,000 men, represents an increase of 0.43%." Full article here : http://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/e...y-201406057197
